_header: Ye that lengen in land Lords and other
Note:
For further fragments of another text see 6306; for another fragment from the same original text see Oxford, Bodleian Library Bodley 264 (SC 2464) below [olim Brown and Robbins (1943)
XCarleton Fairchild Brown, and Rossell Hope Robbins. The Index of Middle English Verse. New York: Printed for the Index Society by Columbia University Press, 1943 4262B].
Title(s): The Story of Alexander and Dindimus
_description: Fragment of a romance of Alexander: ‘The Story of Alexander and Dindimus’ — in alliterative lines

Bod264.First Lines:
Whan þis weith at his wil weduring haddeFul raþe rommede
                    he rydinge þedirre…
Bod264.Last Lines:
…Whan graue was þe graie ston þe grime king
                    rydus& alle meven his men fro þe marke euene
Bod264.Editions:
Stevenson,  Joseph,
                        ed.  
             The Alliterative Romance of Alexander.
Roxburghe Club
         67. London, 1849.

             The Gests of King Alexander of Macedon.
         Cambridge, MA: Harvard UP, 1929; repr. 1973: 121-70.
Sisam,  Celia,  and  Kenneth Sisam, eds.  
             The Oxford Book of Medieval English Verse.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1970: 187-9 (excerpts).

BodGreaves60.First Lines:
Yee þat lengen in lond lordes and ooþerBeurnes or
                    bacheleres þat boldely thenken…
BodGreaves60.Last Lines:
…ffor a feller in fyght founde men seeldeWhile hym lasted his
                    life londes to yeeme
BodGreaves60.Attributed Title:
Þe Worþie King and Emperour Alisaunder of Macedoine (f.
                    iv)

Magoun,  Francis Peabody,
